Fantastic game! A must play!
Creativity, gameplay, graphics, sounds, level design is beyond perfect. Not to mention it came out 2007 and still is ultra fun 2022.

Advanced chambers - literally the same levels but harder, so you need to figure out a different strategy. Quite fun after you have beat the game.

Bonus maps - Same levels as the normal ones but with 3 different objectives :
1. Least portals
2. Least steps
3. Least time
You get bronze, silver and gold depending on how well you performed. And speaking from what me and other people think: 
Bronze - not hard
Silver - you need to practice a lot
Gold - ultra hard to do it without watching a tutorial and there are some levels that literally need to be done with glitches (spam a portal till it goes behind inside a room behind the wall) or "portal pop" which is hard, annoying and most times gets you killed.
If i have to rank them in order of fun - least portals > least time > least steps

Achievements that are annoying:
1. Long Jump (Jump 300 feet) put 2 portals in a way that you glitch your character to always flip in the air so you can loop.
2. Terminal Velocity (Fall 30,000 feet) put 2 portals 1 above the other so it makes a perfect loop and literally wait for 6+ minutes .......

Achievements that are a fine touch:
1. Transmission Received - every level has 1 or more hidden radios that you need to find and then take to an unknown spot where it switches frequency
2. Camera Shy - detach 33 cameras - oddly satisfying
The best game I played ever. the entelegence, the marks on the walls, GLaDOS all of it make this game way better than any puzzel game ever made. Portal 1 and 2 are just great.

if you expected to see a review of why this game is so good, you¬¥re wrong. Here¬¥s how to make butterfly shrimp.
1. Tails on, tails off. Its up to you. I'll be doing shrimp with tails off
2. Rinse out the shrimp in a colander. Keep them in a bowl of cold water for now.
3. Take a shrimp and peel off the shells. If the shells aren't already split, use a sharp knife to split the shells along the shrimps back.
4. Pluck off any remaining legs
5. Gently remove the tail with 2 or 3 fingers. The shells can make a great seafood stock base. It's up to you if you want to keep them.
5. Using the tip of a curved paring knife, make a shallow cut along the back of the shrimp, stopping before the tail. 
6. Drag the icky veins out of the shrimp using the paring knife. 
7. Using a chef's knife, deepen the cut you have already made. Don't cut all the way through the shrimp or you'll split it in half
8. The shrimp should now gently unfold open
9. Pull away the ventral nerve with a knife.
10. Dry shrimp until cooking
11. When it comes to frying them, use a thin batter of your choosing. 
12. Fry in vegetable oil heated to 350F (176C) for 1 to 2 minutes. 
13, The smaller the shrimp, the quicker they fry. Keep a close eye on them while working. Ideally, a good fried shrimp will be buttery with no chew

¬°Es un juegazo!

Recuerdo que la primera vez que lo jugu√© fue por all√° en el 2008 y qued√© enamorado, los acertijos a resolver, las mec√°nicas de juego, GlaDos (mi amor plat√≥nico), todo me encant√≥.

Eres un sujeto de pruebas que tiene que resolver unas pruebas usando una pistola de portales mientras eres guiado por la adorable GlaDos, una inteligencia artifical demente que controla las instalaciones y quiere matarte mientras aparenta apoyarte. A trav√©s de todas las pruebas creas un v√≠nculo con GlaDOs y aprendes a usar tu pistola de portales para superar pruebas cada vez m√°s complicadas que te har√°n pensar y te har√°n sentir bien contigo mismo cuando resuelves los problemas. 

A lo largo de los niveles empiezas a amar a GlaDos aunque quiera matarte, es que sus di√°logos son de lo mejor, su voz rob√≥tica es hipnotizante y su apariencia de varias esferas de un ojo (n√∫cleos de personalidad) te enamora a primera vista y te hace lesbiana (porque tu personaje es una mujer). 

Al final, te pasas el juego, escuchas el temazo de tema final que te pone a bailar y a cantarlo y quedas con ese vac√≠o que s√≥lo te puede llenar Portal 2, as√≠ que vas y compras el 2.

En definitiva, uno de mis juegos favoritos, puede ser un poco corto ya que con mis 15 horas de juego lo he superado al 100% con todos sus logros que son pocos, pero a√∫n as√≠ valen cada segundo.

Recomiendo el juego violentamente, es de lo mejor que hay despu√©s de Half Life.

Five days ago, as of time of this writing, I have been browsing the Steam Store Page looking for a discounted game to try with the one dollar I had on my cash account. After minutes of scrolling, my eyes fell on Portal, the critically acclaimed video game I have been hearing about for the past years. And after hours of contemplation I decided to but it.

Safe to say, it was the best decision I have ever made.

Portal's puzzles are immensely unique and satisfying, beginning with basic puzzles to introduce you to the controls and gameplay before sending you off to solve more challenging tests.

You may often scratch your head and have breakdown when trying to figure out this tests. But when you do, you feel a sense of euphoria wash over you. You'll shout out "I did it!" when you finally find out the answer to each puzzle offered to you. I know it may sound cliche, but it's true! Not only that but the main villain of the story is interesting and humorous. not to mention the world design! You'll become heavily invested as you continue exploring the defunct Aperture Science Laboratories.

That's to say it is without it's flaws. Two of Portal's most indistinguishable flaws is the fact that it is both short and barely has any replay value. I have beaten this game in under four hours and put in some time with the Bonus Maps. After that it was hard for me to continue playing, as one of Portal's strengths is the feeling you have when you solve a puzzle.

However, despite it's shortcomings, it is incredibly outweighed by the good of this game. Anyone who even has a passing interest in playing video games must play this within their lifetime! 

So, all in all, yeah. It's really good.
